replies.msg:
Given OA = OB and angle AOB = 2 * angle APB
Show that O is the circumcentre of triangle ABP.


Let H be a point on AP such that OH bisects angle AOB.

angle HOB = angle HPB
Thus H, O, B, P are concyclic.
=> angle OPH = angle OBH

Note that triangle AOH and triangle BOH are congruent. (SAS)
=> angle OAH = angle OBH

Thus angle OAH = angle OPH
=> OA = OP (sides opp. equal angles)

Since OA=OB=OP, O is the circumcentre of triangle ABP.
